intro: Monoon longipes, commonly known as the longipes moonseed, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically followed by elongated, fleshy fruits. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated for traditional herbal use.
